fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63995].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition:
At the moment, JIRA will display every Comments on the Comment tab. But, there is no context when it is done. Hence, Users would not know when does the comment being inserted on the comment. With a scenario where a comment is required for a transition as a context why it got transitioned, it would be hard to find it unless the users need to go through the history tab or activity tab that is just not showing comments.

h3 Suggested Solution:
To label the comment that is done wit a specific operating will be great like adding:
# Comment added in Transition <status>
# Commend added when Editing ticket.

This will give more context why a comment is added at that time.

h3. Why is it needed:
To include more context and the reason why a comment is added.
fields.summary: Label for comments that is done when doing transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63994].
  {panel}

The JIRA cloud and server rest documentation both state in certain rest resources that they cannot be accessed anonymously. However, when "Anyone" is granted the "Browser User" permission anonymous users can use some rest resources for which the documentation states that they are not permitted access.

The following rest resources have this documentation issue:

1. [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/groupuserpicker-findUsersAndGroups] / [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/groupuserpicker-findUsersAndGroups] 

2. [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/user-findUsersForPicker] / [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/user-findUsersForPicker] 

3. [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/user-findUsers] /  [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/user-findUsers] 

4. [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/user-findUsersWithBrowsePermission] / [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/user-findUsersWithBrowsePermission]
fields.summary: The rest documentation around certain user resources is incorrect with respect to anonymous access and the "Browser User" permission
Support Docker Container
The visibility of a JIRA comment needs to be defaulted to a specific group.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63990].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

It is difficult to debug notification schemes and email settings when configuring JIRA projects.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be nice to have a flag or details attached to events in the activity tab for an issue to show which activities generated emails.

h3. Workaround


# Use the [Notification Helper| https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/jira-admin-helper-828788195.html#JIRAAdminHelper-NotificationHelper ]
# Turn on the outgoing email log in Administration -> Logging and profiling and use the log to track activity.
fields.summary: Show email information with events in issue activity tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63989].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When managing a large number of Filter Results gadgets across dashboards, it is time-consuming and difficult if you need to add/remove fields from all of the gadgets.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add support for Filter Results Fields Schemes which would allow you to manage the fields shown by the Filter Results gadgets in one place without having to edit each gadget when you need to add/remove a field.
 
h3. Workaround

Manually edit the gadgets on each dashboard.
fields.summary: Support field schemes for the Filter Results gadget
Feature Request: Add option to prevent syncing users that have an external Id that matches the existing one

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63987].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If you set the export of jira issues to use pipe delimited and then entered this in the first line
sep=|
then there would be no issue with loading the file in Excel. Because you do not define the separator on export to csv, it does not open in excel correctly. 
This was not an issue with the previous version but in this version, it is comma delimited and named csv... this does not open in most default Excel programs any more.

h3. Suggested Solution
The best solution is to do this:
– set the export to use | (pipe delimited) for a separator
– have the output write the line 'sep=|' on the first line by itself

h3. Why this is important
When you click on it, there is no risk of comma's being an issue and it opens in Excel correctly.

h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: Comma delimited and named csv... these does not open in most default Excel programs any more.
Update documentation for External User Management option
DssSpark

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63984].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Outdated information is listed on our JIRA 7 documentation for running the https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Running+JIRA+applications+as+a+Windows+service#RunningJIRAapplicationsasaWindowsservice-Troubleshooting regarding 64 bit memory issues with Tomcat and JDK. This only applies to 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-windows-service-integrated-with-64-bit-java-consumes-all-allowed-memory-and-never-releases-it-235110422.html and JIRA 7 is now running on Tomcat 8. See 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Supported+platforms for reference. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove the information regarding the 64 JDK: "You cannot run JIRA as a service on a 64-bit operating system if you require allocating more than 1.5GB of memory, due to 32-bit JDK memory limitations and 64-bit JDK/Tomcat service issues."
h3. Why this is important
Confuses users and sets the false expectation that an install failure might be a result of the above.
fields.summary: Update JIRA 7 troubleshooting windows service documentation
Time Tracking Report Filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63977].

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when searching *Project* in JQL will only searching for *Project First name* and First letter of *Project Key*.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow JIRA to search the entire text of the Project Name.
fields.summary: Allow user to search Project with the middle name.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63976].

h3. Problem Definition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63972].

The curent docs at https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-enable-detailed-sql-logging-in-jira-665224933.html do describe that the SQL dump log is described.

In JIRA 6.4 and later versions there is a new option:

fields.description:

h3. Problem Definition
The search function within the link menu (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Linking+issues) does not work with text search.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the same functionality as the quick search in the top menu bar.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63967].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently you only have the options to use Monday or Sunday as your week start day depending on if ISO8601 standard is being used in look and feel. Some JIRA users will want to set a different day other than Sunday or Monday

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way for users to select their own start day

h3. Why this is important
For unique situations where a company may start their week on a different day of the week.
fields.summary: Ability to choose a different day of the week to be the start day

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63965].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA uses XMLRPC to communicate with Confluence in four ways:
 # Retrieve lists of spaces from the instance.
 # Search for content in the instance (globally or by space).
 # Given a {{pageId}}, retrieve page titles and urls for Confluence content.
 # Given a URL, retrieve a {{pageId}} for what is assumed to be Confluence content.

JIRA should use Confluence's REST API to (2). This would resolve a number of issues related to successful searching for content in Confluence – e.g., searching terms that include UTF8 characters (like Japanese, Chinese, etc.).

This is related to JRA-63964, but this issue is concerned with searching for Confluence content, whereas JRA-63964 is concerned with retrieving info for already-linked content.
fields.summary: Use Confluence's REST API to search for page content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63964].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA uses XMLRPC to communicate with Confluence in four ways:
 # Retrieve lists of spaces from the instance.
 # Search for content in the instance (globally or by space).
 # Given a {{pageId}}, retrieve page titles and urls for Confluence content.
 # Given a URL, retrieve a {{pageId}} for what is assumed to be Confluence content.

JIRA should use Confluence's REST API to achieve (3). This would resolve issues with ClassCastExceptions and other remote errors that occur when retrieving Confluence content via XMLRPC.
fields.summary: Use Confluence's REST API to retrieve Confluence page link data
Make it possible to create "system" users for integration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63961].
  {panel}

h3. Definition

It would be great if we can search via user properties. Let say, the reporter of the issues are from different location, then it will be practical to sort the issues via the location of it's reporter.
h3. Suggestion

Add the user properties as a sub property of the Reporter/Assignee fields on the issue navigator.
fields.summary: Ability to Search with User Properties

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63960].
  {panel}

h2. Problem Definition

When the Contact Site Administrators form is not enabled it is not possible to customize the standard message "Your JIRA administrator has not yet configured this contact form."


h2. Suggested Solution

Customers would like to be able to customize the message "Your JIRA administrator has not yet configured this contact form." as if the form is not enabled there is no way to let the end user know who to contact or what to do. 
 
h2. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Contact Site Administrators message cannot be customized when the form is not enabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63957].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The JIRA Admin Helper can help admins diagnose why a user can or cannot perform some actions on a certain issue based on Project Permissions. However, it is not helpful when trying to find out project-based permissions:

# What projects do I have Administer Projects permission on and what grants me that access (e.g. role X/group Z)?
# What projects does user X have Administer Projects permission on and what grants them that access (e.g. role X/group Z)?
# What projects is user X a project lead in so that we can replace them if needed?

You may be able to use:

1)  The following [advanced JQL functions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER072/Advanced+searching+-+functions+reference] which let you search based on roles or permissions, but the output is issue based and not easily represents the projects you have access to. 

{code:borderStyle=solid}project in projectsWhereUserHasPermission("Administer Projects") or project in projectsWhereUserHasRole("Administrators") ORDER BY project{code}

2) The [getPermissions|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/7.2.3/#api/2/-getPermissions] REST call, but you would need to script it out to feed it all projects and clean the data somehow.

3) SQL queries to capture the projects you have admin permissions in.

There is no user-friendly method to get this from JIRA even though this information is critical to manage an enterprise-sized instance.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Expand the scope of the permission helper to be able to get this data, which is essential for general user management.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like the Admin Helper to allow simple permission reporting
Make menus for Issue Types and Projects taller on Modify Configuration Scheme page
As a JIRA Data center Administrator it would be useful to have Scheduled Jobs Logging in a single location

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63954].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

We are not able to show Confluence tasks list in JIRA. We have the gadget Confluence tasks, although the xml is not available to share it on JIRA.

h3. Suggestion

Allow the gadget to be implemented in JIRA or a solution where we can see Confluence tasks in JIRA.

h3. Workarounds
None
fields.summary: Show Confluence Tasks in JIRA
Include changelog for webhooks triggered by post function

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63948].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, once watcher is added , they will get notified for every event depending on Notification scheme.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a button next to the watchers-field in a Jira issue ticket to set or unset email notification. So every user can decide if he / she want a email or not if the Status changed of an ticket.
fields.summary: Ability for Watchers to Disable Notification for selected Issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63947].
  {panel}

h3. Definition:

According to [https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-8.0-doc/security-howto.html], only three folders should be writable in JIRA namely, logs, temp and work. However, conf folder is also writable as documented in [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-throws-severe-message-during-startup-due-to-unable-to-create-directory-for-deployment-389781040.html.] 
h3. Suggestion:

Configure tomcat to write to “work/Catalina” instead of “conf/Catalina.
fields.summary: Improve Tomcat Security
Comment links open in new tab option
Only "depends on" linking on CSV import available, "dependency of" required

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63944].
  {panel}

Hi out there,

I use my Agile Scrum Dashboard a lot, but not in a classical way of using sprints, but rather to organize some common stuff in a separate Backlog. This works fine for me.

So since I quite rarely use sprints - allthough I know exactly what it is, it doesn't really fit my requirements - I have to transition quite often Issues to "Start Progress", "Stop Progress" or "Resolve"... This is possible, but only thourgh the "..." Menu -> More Actions, where I can find the transitions....

I would be nice to integrate these transitions steps directly in the popup menu when clicking on "..." Menu button.I can already Edit, Assign, Log Work, Attach Files and more.... But simple transition is some more clicks away....

I know.... I could/or should use sprints, since Backlogs are not really there for transition... But it really depends... At least for me, this would support me in my manner of work.
fields.summary: Faster access to Issue Transition on Agile Backlag

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63942].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition:

For long established JIRA Servers, over time many projects may no longer be necessary. Knowing when they were created, who owned them, when they were last updated, number of issues, etc. would be a good addition to regular JIRA Server Administration so that unnecessary or old Projects can be pruned on a regular basis.
h3. Suggested Solution:

There should be a tool for native project analysis/archival/mgmt workflow that allows administrators to View _all_ project characteristics, such as: project create date, last updated date, total # of issues, project owners/admins in the Administration are of the product.
h3. Why this is needed:

Reducing the size of a large JIRA Server is good for performance, and makes the server easier to manage.
fields.summary: Project Analysis Tool

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63941].
  {panel}

{panel:title=23rd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

We have revisited this issue again recently and will state that there are no plans to currently implement this suggestion. There are already a number of existing add-ons in the [marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/] that handle this use-case, and I recommend utilising them for your instance to add types or attributes the work in Log Work.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

///

For each task we need a little IMPLEMENTATION, ANALAYSIS, PROJECT MANAGMENT, TESTING, DOCUMENTATION...I wouldn't like to split one task into several tasks just to know how much time was spent on different types of work.

It would be great if user could specify what type of work was he doing in Log Work.
fields.summary: Add type of work in Log work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63939].
  {panel}

Our JIRA Database administrator has notified us of the following issues on our LJIRA01 DB. Can you please help with the action item.
Findings and Recommendations
---------------------------------------------------
Finding 1: Commits and Rollbacks
Impact is 10.53 active sessions, 78.61% of total activity.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Waits on event "log file sync" while performing COMMIT and ROLLBACK operations
were consuming significant database time.
Recommendation 1: Application Analysis
Estimated benefit is 10.53 active sessions, 78.61% of total activity.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Action:Investigate application logic for possible reduction in the number of COMMIT operations by increasing the size of transactions.
Rationale:The application was performing 58855 transactions per minute with an average redo size of 645 bytes per transaction
fields.summary: Optimize Database COMMIT operations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63937].
  {panel}

h2. Problem Definition

When the Contact Site Administrators form is enabled, users could create SPAM or abuse the system as there is no CAPTCHA for that form.
h2. Suggested Solution

Add a CAPTCHA to the Contact Site Adminsitrator form to avoid SPAM
  
h2. Workaround

There is no workaround apart from not having the form enabled.
fields.summary: Add a CATPCHA or a method to stop spam to the "Contact Site Administrator Form"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63935].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

There is a limit on the number of character in Comment, Description, etc. Sometime, users would add a huge text as a comment/description and it would be great if JIRA could automatically convert it into a file and attach it as an issue attachment.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to automatically convert huge text into a file and attach is as an issue attachment.
fields.summary: Provide a feature to automatically convert huge text into a file
Update REST API issue properties documentation
API Documentation for Cookie Based authentication needs update

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63929].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It is possible that an installed plugin is enabled on some of the nodes while disabled on the other nodes on the same JIRA Data Center installation.

h3. Suggested Solution
Health Check for JIRA DC should check the status of these installed plugin for each node so the administrator will be informed and enable them manually.

h3. Why this is important
Inconsistency in reviewing data or functionality for users on different nodes.
 
h3. Workaround 
Run {{http://<nodeURL>/rest/plugins/1.0/enablement-state}} on each nodes to check the add-ons enable status.
fields.summary: Health Check to check add-on status on JIRA Data Center
Document the /status URL for JIRA
Allow users to categorize or label filters so that Manage Filters isn't some massive, undifferentiated list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63924].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
[Unattended installation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/unattended-installation-855475683.html] of JIRA starts JIRA automatically after installation. As of JIRA 7.3, using the installer will give you the option to startup JIRA or not after the installation. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a parameter to specify the instance not to startup after the upgrade/installation.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I would like Unattended installation of JIRA to have the option to not start automatically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63923].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, CATALINA_BASE and CATALINA_HOME are in the same location. As per recommendations from https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-8.0-doc/RUNNING.txt :
bq. Using distinct values for the CATALINA_HOME and CATALINA_BASE variables is recommended to simplify further upgrades and maintenance.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have an independent CATALINA_BASE and CATALINA_HOME
fields.summary: As an Admin, I would like to have an independent CATALINA_BASE and CATALINA_HOME

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63922].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is not possible to set a minimum or maximum field length for validation so users would be able to input any characters without fulfilling business requirement.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to configure field length validators
h3. Why this is important
To allow standardization for field values
fields.summary: Add the ability to configure field length validators

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63920].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently when we allow JIRA instance to be public so that our users can access it from any part of the world, anonymous user who does not have access to JIRA instance or does not even related to our JIRA instance able to access to the managed filter page as well as filters (which is shared with everyone- there is a feature request at [JRA-63890|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-63890] to provide improvement on this) 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide Feature for JIRA Administrator to Configure Which Link should be Shown and Which Link Should be Hidden from search engines

h3. Why this is important
Such bottleneck in JIRA can potentially cause security issue to the data hosted in our JIRA instance as anonymous users able to browse up to filter level when JIRA is made available to be accessed via internet from anywhere.

h3. Workaround 
Use robot.txt as mentioned in [Using robots.txt to hide from search engines|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/using-robots-txt-to-hide-from-search-engines-802593007.html].
fields.summary: Ability to Configure Links that Should be Visible and Hidden in JIRA Instance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63918].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary

With the Security demands of some organization, the usage of the Java Security Manager would be considered necessary if they are to make use of Atlassian products.

Currently however, JIRA does not support the usage of the Java Security Manager as seen [in this ticket|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-21031].
* Also mentioned [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-16154].

h5. Feature Request

Can this feature be implemented in JIRA?
fields.summary: Support Java Security Manager

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63917].
{panel}
Several cloud-based mail providers, chiefly Google and Microsoft, have announced plans to end support for basic authentication for IMAP. Jira needs to be able to support these providers over a modern authentication protocol such as OAuth.

[Google has paused their plans to shut off OAuth due to COVID-related impacts on organizations|https://workspaceupdates.googleblog.com/2020/03/less-secure-app-turn-off-suspended.html], and will give 12 months advance notice when they set a new timeline.

Jira Cloud also *now supports OAuth for Microsoft accounts* per JRACLOUD-73240. Jira Service Management now supports OAuth for Google and Microsoft per JRACLOUD-72590. The remaining ask here is for OAuth with Google/Gmail and the primary Jira mail handler.

 
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 3 June 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hello Everyone,

We would like to provide you with an update on bringing OAuth support for incoming emails on Jira Cloud. Firstly, we would like to assure you that we are still working on this feature and remain committed to releasing OAuth support as soon as possible. 

As part of our endeavor to improve the security of our incoming email service, along with the release of OAuth support, we plan to move from IMAP/POP to Gmail APIs/MS Graph APIs to retrieve emails. The team is working to bring this smarter, more performant, and more secure service very soon but would like to take a moment to get some feedback from customers in this regard.

If you have any concerns about the service moving to APIs, we'd like to hear about them and understand the details. Please reach out to me at asom at atlassian dot com.

Thanks and regards,
Arjoon Som
Sr. PM, Jira Cloud
{panel}
fields.summary: 3-legged OAuth Authentication for IMAP support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63916].
  {panel}

When you're using the keyboard to set some fields, for example, the assignee field:
 # You can type the name of the assignee to find him in the list
 # You can go up and down in the list using arrow keys
 # To select an assignee, you need to hit enter
 # To save the change you need to hit enter once again

It'd be nice if, in this case, the second enter to update the field wasn't needed. Which means the assignee would be selected and updated with a single enter.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63911].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The documentation for [Creating issues using the csv importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver072/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-829057518.html] has a section for attachments, but the bulk create from CSV does not support attachments.  

  !Screen Shot 2017-01-27 at 2.23.12 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.3 Docs

h3. Expected Results

Documentation for the Issue -> Import from CSV functionality should not reference attachments.

h3. Actual Results

The documentation [Creating issues using the csv importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver072/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-829057518.html] has a section for importing attachments via CSV.

h3.Notes

This is similar to ----JRA-39749----, but covers different functionality.  The system level import from external system csv import does support attachments, but the CSV import in the Issues menu does not.
fields.summary: Import issues from CSV does not support attachments but attachments are in the docs

Fields of these types should be able to be visible and editable in the mobile app.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63909].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Create SMTP mail Server
 2. Setup POP/IMAP mail server and a *create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue* mail handler and check the *CC Watchers* field
 3. Send an email with the cc field to some other email address(which the user is register in JIRA) to the mail server and JIRA expectedly create a issue from it and added cc field email address into watchers of that issue.
 4. After that, if continue to reply that email it will actually comment on that issue however if the cc field of the mail address is added some other email address, it won't add those email address as watchers.

Use case:
 # We are currently using JIRA as a CRM tool and as a result we want to quickly loop in other JIRA users onto a ticket for visibility and response
 # However with the current setup this is not possible and if the team is travelling, they are not able to access JIRA without being on VPN to add addtional watchers.
fields.summary: Add people as watchers via email CC once a ticket has already been created?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63908].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In the Rich Text Editor Documentation for JIRA 7.2:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver072/visual-editing-838542506.html

The Notation states:
{quote}
Visual editing is part of a Labs feature in JIRA platform 7.2. Labs features can be turned off by your administrator, so if you don't have access to visual editing, that's probably why.
{quote}

BUT Labs functionality changed in 7.2 and the only documentation for enabling labs features is for 7.0:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER070/JIRA+Software+Labs
-- this document notes the labs features are under >> Administration > Applications > JIRA software Labs

This LABS sub menu no longer exists as of jira 7.2 and the *Rich Text Editor* Labs Feature was given its own Sub Menu under:
- Administration >> System >> USER INTERFACE >> Rich Text Editor
- OR >> G+G "Rich Text Editor"

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the 7.2 and newer Visual editor Documentation to Include locations of the rich text editor menu:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver072/visual-editing-838542506.html
{quote}
Visual editing is part of a Labs feature in JIRA platform 7.2. Labs features can be turned off by your administrator, so if you don't have access to visual editing, that's probably why.

The Feature can be enabled and disabled under *Administration* >> *System* >> *USER INTERFACE* >> *Rich Text Editor*    OR    *G+G* search for "Rich Text Editor"
{quote}
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor Documentation Correction

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63907].
  {panel}

h3. What

Add a new column to the fileattachment table in the JIRA database called "hash" and store in there the SHA256 hash (or even MD5) of the file.

 
h3. Why

By adding this column, plugins for JIRA will be able to add significant new functionality to Jira. Future versions of JIRA will also be able to leverage this to achieve:
 * Prevent the same attachment being added many times to the same issue (for example, logos from inbound email)
 * Deduplicate attachment storage
 * Integrity checking that the attachment on disk is unmodified
 * Blacklist certain attachments from being added to the system (eg. again logos in inbound emails)
fields.summary: Add SHA hash to fileattachment table
As an administrator, I would like for NFSv4 to be officially supported for JIRA Data Center

more granularity in watchers permissions would be great.

I would like to be able to allow a user to :
 * add/remove themselves from watchers list.
 * add/remove anyone from watchers list.

This way the first permission could be granted to everyone, and they can only mess with which tickets they are watching. Project managers can get the second level and add people they feel need to be watching an ticket.

While editing JIRA issue or comment the font style switching to _Monospaced_ formatting is not intuitive and incorrect - it is missing in the following context menu:

!image-2017-01-03-11-22-37-166.png|width=147,height=138!

I can easily select _Citation_, _Subscript_, etc. but _Monospaced_ is missing in this context menu.

Yes, you can select _Style -> Preformatted_, but it changes the style in the whole paragraph and what user often wants is to change formatting of a {{single word or sentence}}.


 User just wants to efficiently and quickly change formatting while typing and it's not possible at the moment without switching from Visual to Text mode and back.
fields.summary: Intuitive switch to Monospaced formatting in Visual mode

h3. Problem Definition
It is currently not possible to translate custom field descriptions or names on Field Configurations.

h3. Suggested Solution
Since field configurations allow users to add different descriptions than the custom field original descriptions, it would be great to be able to translate them, as well as the custom field name.
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: As a JIRA applications administrator, I would like to be able to translate fields and descriptions on the Field Configuration level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63890].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no proper documentation that explain the *anyone* permission which is available to be used in Filters and dashboard.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide Documentation explaining the use case of these permission so that the users who are using this permission will have better understanding on the expected behavior from the usage of this permission.

h3. Why this is important
Currently a normal JIRA user expect that *anyone* permission is only applicable for all the users who are registered for an account in their JIRA instance however they are not aware that this permission can allow anonymous users who are not related to JIRA can view all the shared objects that is using *anyone* permission. This behavior causes some serious security breach concern as well as misunderstanding in users end.
fields.summary: Provide Documentation Explaining The Usage Of Filter Permission

h3. Problem Description

The feature to view Mail Queue used to exist in the system settings where user can see the email messages currently in the queue, to flush the mail queue immediately, and to manage failed email messages in Error Queue. However the option to view Mail Queue is now gone.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to view Mail Queue, or to manage the mail queue and failed email messages.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem definition
Certain searches causes Google to index duplicate JIRA urls. 

h6. For Example:
Using -> site:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-62251
 !example-site.png|thumbnail! 

This happens because both pages return *200*, which is the reason Google indexes both pages. This in return harms SEO rankings on Google.

h3. Suggested Solution
#  Update JIRA to return *301* in the relevant cases, for example, when retrieving the results for an issue through the issue view.
# JIRA should be able to use canonical in the relevant cases to identify duplicates. 
#* [Google-Use canonical URLs|https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/139066?hl=en]

h3. workaround
# Use seo tools to filter out url patterns that google detects as duplicate.
# [Use robots.txt to hide from search engines|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/using-robots-txt-to-hide-from-search-engines-802593007.html]
fields.summary: JIRA causing duplicate pages to be indexed in Google

h3. Summary
When scrolling through an issue, the Summary top panel does not freeze on the screen. It scrolls with the screen.

h3. Environment
# In JIRA 7.1.10 (as well as 6.4.11), it was possible to freeze the Summary at the top of the screen.
# In JIRA 7.3, the Summary field is scrolling with the screen. It does not stay on the screen.

 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to an issue on the browser on JIRA 7.3. Its better if the issue has a few comments so you can scroll on the page. (Tested on this site)
# Scroll through the issue
# The Summary field does not stay on the screen

h3. Expected Results
The Summary field should stay on the screen just like earlier versions.

h3. Actual Results
The Summary field does not stay on the screen.
fields.summary: While scrolling issue on Issue view screen, does not freeze the Summary panel at the top

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63861].
  {panel}

Two packages in JIRA's Java API seem to provide interfaces that would allow a plugin to manipulate the OAuth consumers/providers. This would allow plugins to provide a much better configuration experience than manual configuration of OAuth consumers/providers. The 2 packages are:
* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/server/com/atlassian/jira/oauth/consumer/package-summary.html
* https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/server/com/atlassian/jira/oauth/serviceprovider/package-summary.html

Unfortunately, these document nothing more than the list of Classes and Methods. Since there's no link to the common package for `com.atlassian.oauth`, it is impossible to figure out how to provide the correct parameters for key methods, like `put()`.
fields.summary: Document Java APIs for OAuth
Remove content from activity stream

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63854].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Unable to remove group from default member of project role when group was added using different case than actual group name.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Example 1:
 # Create a local mixed case group, example: {{abCd}}
 # Go to Administration > System > Project roles
 # Choose any of the project roles, then click on _Manage Default Members_
 # Under _Default Groups_ click on Edit
 # Add the group by typing the group name {{abcd}} in the text field
 # Try to remove the group

Example 2:
 # Create a lower case group, example: {{testgroup}}
 # Go to Administration > System > Project roles
 # Choose any of the project roles, then click on _Manage Default Members_
 # Under _Default Groups_ click on Edit
 # Add the group by typing the group name in the text field. Type group name using upper case or mixed case.
 # Try to remove the group

h3. Expected Results

Group will be removed
h3. Actual Results

Group cannot be removed. Attempting to remove group causes page to refresh, group does not get removed.
h3. Notes
 * The Bug does not affect mixed case groups alone. It affects all groups (jira-software-users is affected if you enter Jira-Software-Users)
 * The problem occurs when the case of the group name entered into the text field does not exactly match the name of the group
 ** Group name foo; you enter foo (/)
 ** Group name foo; you enter Foo (x)
 ** Group name Foo; you enter Foo (/)

h3. Workaround

*To prevent this issue, add the group via the group picker instead of typing name.*

To remove groups that cannot be removed in the UI: (Server only)
 # Obtain ID of role that needs to be edited
 ** On the page where you remove the group, look at the URL and note "projectRoleId" that appears
 # [Back up your data |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/adminjiraserver073/Backing+Up+Data]
 # Shutdown JIRA
 # In database, {{SELECT * FROM projectroleactor WHERE pid IS NULL and projectroleid = <projectRoleId>;}}
 ** Replace <projectRoleId> with the ID obtained in step 1.
 ** This will return the entries for that project role.
 # For each entry that needs to be removed:
 ** {{DELETE FROM projectroleactor WHERE id = <id of row>;}}
 ** Replace <id of row> with the ID of the row that contains the group name that needs to be removed.
 # Start JIRA
 # Navigate to default project role members page and confirm appropriate groups appear.

Cloud customers should contact support to have the group(s) removed.
fields.summary: Cannot remove group from default project role members when added with wrong case

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63853].
  {panel}

+Issue Summary+

Following the release of JIRA 7.2, the option to *collect users Browser info* became optional allowing user to opt-in to it or not for this information to be collected.

+The Problem+

Due to the position of this checkbox being at the bottom of the page, it is possible for users to miss this without checking it and because of that, it could make troubleshooting the problem difficult for the JIRA team.

+What We Need+

Can an exact reason this was changed from automatically collecting information to allowing user opt-in be added into the documentation to help clarify things?
fields.summary: Issue Collector Documentation

  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Use http://requestb.in/ to create a WebHook to the JIRA instance
# Setup the WebHook with a JQL that uses the IssueFunction propriety to remove the Cloned issues: {{ project = TEST and issueFunction not in linkedIssuesOf("project = TEST", "is cloned by")}}
# Check the "Create" action for this JQL
# Create a Issue on the Project and you'll notice that the JSON is created correctly
# Clone that issue and a JSON will still be sent, despite the JQL result on Issue Search not including the clones.

h3. Expected Behaviour

The WebHooks should ignore the cases not returned by the configured JQL.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63843].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When opening issue from a saved filter and perform Inline edit, the first time it works fine but once we reload the issue the inline edit stops working.

h3. Environment
* JIRA version 7.2.4
* JIRA version 7.3.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Issue Navigator and save a filter
# Open the filter and change the view to *list* view
# Click on any issue whereby you will be viewing issue in this url format *https://yourserver/jira/browse/issuekey?filter=10001*
# Try to inline edit the available field to edit. (you will be able to edit)
# Refresh the page and try to inline edit the field again. (you wont be able to edit now)

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to perform inline edit even after refresh the page

h3. Actual Results
The inline edit is not working after refreshing the page

h3.Workaround
Open issue in view issue page to perform inline edit.
fields.summary: Inline Issue Edit Doesn't Work when Editing Issue from Saved Filter
Do not create a customer when emails come in

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63838].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
A user who is a member of the Project Role (Administrators) which has been added to the *Administer Project* permission is unable to edit the Project Lead. According to the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/managing-project-permissions-185729636.html], the *Administer Project* permission allows any user w/ the permission to edit the Project Lead:
bq. Permission to administer a project in JIRA. This includes the ability to edit project role membership, project components, project versions and some project details ('Project Name', 'URL', 'Project Lead', 'Project Description').

However, with this bug, a user with the *Administer Project* permission is unable to edit the Project Lead. No errors -appear in the UI or- in the logs.

As of JIRA 7.2.0-OD-05, receiving the following Error when trying to change the Project Lead or Default Assignee as a Project Admin:
!EditProjectLeadorAssignee.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project and grant the user Project Administration permission
# Login to the instance as the user and navigate to project settings > Users and Roles
# Click on "Edit Defaults"
# Change project lead to another user
# Click "Update"

h3. Expected Results
-The update completes and pop-up window closes.- User is able to update changes to Project Lead and you see the Project Lead correctly updated on the page. 

h3. Actual Results
-The update button does not respond. You will see a brief spinning wheel, but the "Update" button does not actually update the user.-

Receiving an error indicating "You must have global administrator rights in order to modify the project key."

Looking in the logs with {{com.atlassian.jira.security}} DEBUG, all the permissions clear:
{code}
2016-03-04 17:28:28.883949500 2016-03-04 17:28:28,881 http-nio-2990-exec-227 DEBUG rfuerst 1048x24557x1 39fl15 4.15.43.214,10.85.161.148,127.0.0.1 /secure/project/EditProjectLeadAndDefaultAssignee.jspa [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] BROWSE_PROJECTS permission granted by permission scheme
2016-03-04 17:28:28.883951500 2016-03-04 17:28:28,881 http-nio-2990-exec-227 DEBUG rfuerst 1048x24557x1 39fl15 4.15.43.214,10.85.161.148,127.0.0.1 /secure/project/EditProjectLeadAndDefaultAssignee.jspa [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] ADMINISTER_PROJECTS permission granted by permission scheme
2016-03-04 17:28:28.883991500 2016-03-04 17:28:28,881 http-nio-2990-exec-227 DEBUG rfuerst 1048x24557x1 39fl15 4.15.43.214,10.85.161.148,127.0.0.1 /secure/project/EditProjectLeadAndDefaultAssignee.jspa [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] BROWSE_PROJECTS permission granted by permission scheme
2016-03-04 17:28:28.883997500 2016-03-04 17:28:28,881 http-nio-2990-exec-227 DEBUG rfuerst 1048x24557x1 39fl15 4.15.43.214,10.85.161.148,127.0.0.1 /secure/project/EditProjectLeadAndDefaultAssignee.jspa [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] ADMINISTER_PROJECTS permission granted by permission scheme
{code}

h3.Workaround
If you add the user to the {{administrators}} group, they will be able to edit the Project Lead. Or if that is not possible, another project administrator in the {{administrators}} group can make the change.
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud - Project administrator cannot edit Project Lead
